content.description: You will hear an excerpt from a twentieth-century orchestral work that will be played four times. The excerpt begins with an English horn melody, which is followed by a melody played by the violins. Before listening to the music for the first time, please read the questions.
content.question: In comparison to the English horn melody, the violinsâ€™ melody is

choices.label: the same at the beginning and the same at the end
the same at the beginning and different at the end
different at the beginning and the same at the end
different at the beginning and different at the end

content.answer: the same at the beginning and different at the end

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in performed music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
